definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
United Front Work Department of CCP Central Committee (UFWD)
pinyin: Tong3 yi1 Zhan4 xian4 Gong1 zuo4 bu4

sentences.english: Recently, I was called to the Religious Affairs Bureau and the United Front Work Department.
sentences.chinese: 最近我被国家宗教事务局和统一战线工作部传唤。

sentences.english: All Party comrades must strive to consolidate and develop this united front.
sentences.chinese: 全党同志必须为这个统一战线的巩固和发展而奋斗。

sentences.english: They form the progressive section of the anti-Japanese united front.
sentences.chinese: 他们是抗日统一战线中的进步派。

sentences.english: The theory of the united front is developing in different historic periods.
sentences.chinese: 统一战线理论在不同的历史时期不断被丰富和发展。

sentences.english: At one time, he joined a United Front government in Shansi.
sentences.chinese: 他曾一度参加过山西某县的统一战线政府。

sentences.english: We should integrate the united front into the state system, and identify its constitution status.
sentences.chinese: 应当将统一战线纳入国体范畴，从而明确其宪法地位。

sentences.english: The work of the United Front has always been serving the party's general line and construction.
sentences.chinese: 统一战线工作历来是为党的总路线建设和服务的。

sentences.english: The organs of political power of the anti- Japanese united front must be elected by the people.
sentences.chinese: 抗日统一战线政权的产生，应经过人民选举。

sentences.english: Second, the controversy persons had a theoretic exploration to the cultural united front.
sentences.chinese: 其次，论争对文化统一战线进行了理论探索。

sentences.english: Otherwise co-operation will turn into amalgamation and the united front will inevitably be sacrificed.
sentences.chinese: 否则就是将合作变成了混一，必然牺牲统一战线。

sentences.english: The parties of the leave have forme a common front to fight the force of reaction.
sentences.chinese: 政党的左翼组成与反动势力斗争的统一战线。

sentences.english: The United Front and the CPC's administrative competence are complementarily correlative.
sentences.chinese: 统一战线与党的执政能力密切相连，相互促进。

sentences.english: They form the middle section of the anti-Japanese united front.
sentences.chinese: 他们是抗日统一战线中的中间派。

sentences.english: United-front work of a is the basis of our Party's united-front work.
sentences.chinese: 县级统战工作是我们党统一战线工作的基础。

sentences.english: And it is the form which a constitutional government of the anti-Japanese united front should take.
sentences.chinese: 这样的宪政也就是抗日统一战线的宪政。

sentences.english: The research of present united front has great theoretical and practical significance.
sentences.chinese: 研究现阶段统一战线具有重大的理论意义和现实意义。

definition: anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to be of one mind/to think or act alike
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
united front (abbr. for 統一戰線|统一战线[tong3 yi1 zhan4 xian4])
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
Guomindang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
